memberdef.name: PCIE_IRQ_CONNECT
memberdef.initializer: ARCH_PCIE_IRQ_CONNECT(bdf_p, irq_p, priority_p, \ isr_p, isr_param_p, flags_p)

briefdescription.para: Initialize an interrupt handler for a PCIe endpoint IRQ.

detaileddescription.para: This routine is only meant to be used by drivers using PCIe bus and having fixed or MSI based IRQ (so no runtime detection of the IRQ). In case of runtime detection see pcie_connect_dynamic_irq()

parameterdescription.para: Parameter passed to interrupt service routine.

briefdescription.para: A unique PCI(e) endpoint (bus, device, function).

detaileddescription.para: A PCI(e) endpoint is uniquely identified topologically using a (bus, device, function) tuple. The internal structure is documented in include/dt-bindings/pcie/pcie.h: see PCIE_BDF() and friends, since these tuples are referenced from devicetree.

briefdescription.para: A unique PCI(e) identifier (vendor ID, device ID).

detaileddescription.para: The PCIE_CONF_ID register for each endpoint is a (vendor ID, device ID) pair, which is meant to tell the system what the PCI(e) endpoint is. Again, look to PCIE_ID_* macros in include/dt-bindings/pcie/pcie.h for more.

briefdescription.para: Look up the BDF based on PCI(e) vendor & device ID.

detaileddescription.para: This function is used to look up the BDF for a device given its vendor and device ID.

parameterdescription.para: PCI(e) vendor & device ID encoded using PCIE_ID()

simplesect.para: The BDF for the device, or PCIE_BDF_NONE if it was not found

briefdescription.para: Read a 32-bit word from an endpoint's configuration space.

detaileddescription.para: This function is exported by the arch/SoC/board code.

simplesect.para: the word read (0xFFFFFFFFU if nonexistent endpoint or word)

memberdef.argsstring: (pcie_bdf_t bdf, unsigned int reg, uint32_t data)
memberdef.name: pcie_conf_write

briefdescription.para: Write a 32-bit word to an endpoint's configuration space.

detaileddescription.para: This function is exported by the arch/SoC/board code.

briefdescription.para: Probe for the presence of a PCI(e) endpoint.

parameterdescription.para: the endpoint ID to expect, or PCIE_ID_NONE for "any device"

simplesect.para: true if the device is present, false otherwise

memberdef.argsstring: (pcie_bdf_t bdf, unsigned int bar_index, struct pcie_mbar *mbar)
memberdef.name: pcie_get_mbar

briefdescription.para: Get the MBAR at a specific BAR index.

simplesect.para: true if the mbar was found and is valid, false otherwise

memberdef.argsstring: (pcie_bdf_t bdf, unsigned int index, struct pcie_mbar *mbar)
memberdef.name: pcie_probe_mbar

briefdescription.para: Probe the nth MMIO address assigned to an endpoint.

detaileddescription.para:
bdf
the PCI(e) endpoint
index
(0-based) index
mbar
Pointer to struct pcie_mbar
true if the mbar was found and is valid, false otherwise
A PCI(e) endpoint has 0 or more memory-mapped regions. This function allows the caller to enumerate them by calling with index=0..n. Value of n has to be below 6, as there is a maximum of 6 BARs. The indices are order-preserving with respect to the endpoint BARs: e.g., index 0 will return the lowest-numbered memory BAR on the endpoint.

briefdescription.para: Set or reset bits in the endpoint command/status register.

parameterdescription.para: the powerset of bits of interest
use true to set bits, false to reset them

briefdescription.para: Allocate an IRQ for an endpoint.

detaileddescription.para: This function first checks the IRQ register and if it contains a valid value this is returned. If the register does not contain a valid value allocation of a new one is attempted. Such function is only exposed if CONFIG_PCIE_CONTROLLER is unset. It is thus available where architecture tied dynamic IRQ allocation for PCIe device makes sense.

simplesect.para: the IRQ number, or PCIE_CONF_INTR_IRQ_NONE if allocation failed.

briefdescription.para: Return the IRQ assigned by the firmware/board to an endpoint.

simplesect.para: the IRQ number, or PCIE_CONF_INTR_IRQ_NONE if unknown.

briefdescription.para: Enable the PCI(e) endpoint to generate the specified IRQ.

detaileddescription.para:
bdf
the PCI(e) endpoint
irq
the IRQ to generate
If MSI is enabled and the endpoint supports it, the endpoint will be configured to generate the specified IRQ via MSI. Otherwise, it is assumed that the IRQ has been routed by the boot firmware to the specified IRQ, and the IRQ is enabled (at the I/O APIC, or wherever appropriate).

briefdescription.para: Find a PCI(e) capability in an endpoint's configuration space.

simplesect.para: the index of the configuration word, or 0 if no capability.

briefdescription.para: Find an Extended PCI(e) capability in an endpoint's configuration space.

simplesect.para: the index of the configuration word, or 0 if no capability.

memberdef.argsstring: (pcie_bdf_t bdf, unsigned int irq, unsigned int priority, void(*routine)(const void *parameter), const void *parameter, uint32_t flags)
memberdef.name: pcie_connect_dynamic_irq

briefdescription.para: Dynamically connect a PCIe endpoint IRQ to an ISR handler.

parameterdescription.para: the ISR handler to connect to the IRQ
the parameter to provide to the handler
